greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: a(n, k) is the number of ordered m-tuples of positive integers (x_1, ..., x_m) such that max x_i = n+1-m and there are k ones (0 <= k <= n).
comment: The row sums are given by A047970 because row n counts the same tuples as the n-th antidiagonal of A047969.
link: Mathew Englander, Comments on A101494 and A089246, and related sequences
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{j = k+1..n-1} C(j,k)*Sum_{i = j..n-1} T(i,j) for 0 <= k < n-1; T(k+1,k)=0 and T(k,k)=1 for k>=0.
xref: First differences by column of A101494.
results.author: _Alford Arnold_, Dec 22 2003
ext: Edited and extended by _David Wasserman_, Sep 07 2005
